subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] quikscript.org
msgSnippet: I certainly agree with decoupling fonts.  As you might imagine, this would be almost ideal for the site since I would only have to load a single font (i
messageBody:
I certainly agree with decoupling fonts.  As you might imagine, this would be almost ideal for the site since I would only have to load a single font (i think...perhaps none at all).  This isn't my area of expertise so I'd have to test or take suggestions.  The fewer fonts I have to load, the faster the site so I kept only two.  (BTW, no offense to other font writers out there, I happened across King Plus early on and found Steve's email and then saw Scott's excellent work recently.  There are great fonts out there that I haven't gotten to yet.)

I put ABE up the same way as the other fonts, but am not seeing it render correctly. I'll try again after the troops are better rested.

Would I be correct in assuming that those which used Private Area Fonts would need to have the font installed on their computer for it to be visible before submitting?  Possibly the same for other readers?

I'd love to have people who typed using  the hybrid QWERTY technique would be able to communicate with those typing natively in quikscript.

--j
